description: From French quincajou, from an Algonquian word, probably originally meaning ‘wolverine’ (compare Algonquin Kwingwaage, Ojibwe gwiingwa'aage (“wolverine”)), which was later transferred to the South American animal. Related to carcajou.

entries.meaning: Potos flavus, a carnivorous mammal of Central America and South America with a long, prehensile tail, related to the raccoon.
